**Thomas Stanley Holland** (born 1 June 1996)[2] is an English actor and
dancer. He is best known for starring as [Peter Parker / Spider-
Man](/wiki/Spider-Man "Spider-Man") in the superhero films _[Captain America:
Civil War](/wiki/Captain_America:_Civil_War "Captain America: Civil War")_
(2016) and _[Spider-Man: Homecoming](/wiki/Spider-Man:_Homecoming "Spider-Man:
Homecoming")_ (2017), as part of the [Marvel Cinematic
Universe](/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe "Marvel Cinematic Universe") (MCU).

He previously appeared on stage in the title role of _[Billy Elliot the
Musical](/wiki/Billy_Elliot_the_Musical "Billy Elliot the Musical")_ in
London's [West End](/wiki/West_End_theatre "West End theatre"). His other
major films include _[The Impossible](/wiki/The_Impossible_\(2012_film\) "The
Impossible \(2012 film\)")_ (2012), _[In the Heart of the
Sea](/wiki/In_the_Heart_of_the_Sea_\(film\) "In the Heart of the Sea
\(film\)")_ (2015), and _[The Lost City of
Z](/wiki/The_Lost_City_of_Z_\(film\) "The Lost City of Z \(film\)")_ (2016).
Holland received the [BAFTA Rising Star Award](/wiki/BAFTA_Rising_Star_Award
"BAFTA Rising Star Award") in 2017.

## Early life and education

Holland was born in [Kingston upon Thames](/wiki/Kingston_upon_Thames
"Kingston upon Thames"), [London](/wiki/London "London"),[3] to Nicola
Elizabeth (née Frost), a photographer, and [Dominic
Holland](/wiki/Dominic_Holland "Dominic Holland"), a comedian and
author.[4][5] He has three brothers, twins Sam and Harry, three years younger,
and Patrick, eight years younger.[4][6] His paternal grandparents were born on
the [Isle of Man](/wiki/Isle_of_Man "Isle of Man") and
[Tipperary](/wiki/Tipperary "Tipperary"), [Ireland](/wiki/Ireland
"Ireland").[7][8]

Holland was educated at [Donhead](/wiki/Donhead "Donhead"), a Roman Catholic
preparatory school in [Wimbledon](/wiki/Wimbledon,_London "Wimbledon, London")
in South West London,[9] followed by [Wimbledon
College](/wiki/Wimbledon_College "Wimbledon College"), a [voluntary
aided](/wiki/Voluntary_aided_school "Voluntary aided school") Jesuit Roman
Catholic comprehensive school (also in Wimbledon), up until December 2012.
Holland has said he was bullied in school for being a dancer.[10] After
Wimbledon College he attended [The BRIT School for Performing Arts and
Technology](/wiki/BRIT_School "BRIT School").[5]

## Career

### Theatre

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Tom_Holland_Billy_Elliot_2010_2b.jpg/220px-
Tom_Holland_Billy_Elliot_2010_2b.jpg)](/wiki/File:Tom_Holland_Billy_Elliot_2010_2b.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Tom_Holland_Billy_Elliot_2010_2b.jpg "Enlarge")

Holland (centre) performing at the fifth anniversary of _Billy Elliot the
Musical_ , 31 March 2010

Holland began dancing at a hip hop class at Nifty Feet Dance School in
[Wimbledon](/wiki/Wimbledon,_London "Wimbledon, London"). His potential was
spotted by choreographer Lynne Page (who was an associate to [Peter
Darling](/wiki/Peter_Darling "Peter Darling"), choreographer of _[Billy
Elliot](/wiki/Billy_Elliot "Billy Elliot")_ and _[Billy Elliot the
Musical](/wiki/Billy_Elliot_the_Musical "Billy Elliot the Musical")_) when he
performed with his dance school as part of the 2006 Richmond Dance
Festival.[11]

After eight auditions and subsequent two years of training, on 28 June 2008,
Holland made his West End debut in _[Billy Elliot the
Musical](/wiki/Billy_Elliot_the_Musical "Billy Elliot the Musical")_ as
Michael, Billy's best friend.[12] He gave his first performance in the title
role on 8 September 2008, receiving positive notices.[6][13]

In September 2008, Holland (together with co-star Tanner Pflueger) appeared on
the news programme on channel [FIVE](/wiki/Five_\(TV_channel\) "Five \(TV
channel\)") and gave his first TV interview. The following year, he was
featured on [ITV1](/wiki/ITV1 "ITV1") show _The Feel Good Factor_.[14] At the
launch show on 31 January he and two other Billy Elliots, Tanner Pflueger and
[Layton Williams](/wiki/Layton_Williams "Layton Williams"), performed a
version of Angry Dance from _Billy Elliot the Musical_ , after which Holland
was interviewed by host [Myleene Klass](/wiki/Myleene_Klass "Myleene Klass").
He trained five British schoolboys for a dance routine he fronted for the
final _The Feel Good Factor_ show on 28 March 2009.[15]

On 8 March 2010, to mark the fifth anniversary of _Billy Elliot the Musical_ ,
four current Billy Elliots, including Holland, were invited to [10 Downing
Street](/wiki/10_Downing_Street "10 Downing Street") to meet the [Prime
Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom "Prime Minister of the
United Kingdom") [Gordon Brown](/wiki/Gordon_Brown "Gordon Brown").[16][17]
Holland was chosen to be a lead at the fifth-anniversary show on 31 March
2010.[18] Holland had been appearing on a regular basis as Billy in _Billy
Elliot the Musical_ , rotating with three other performers,[19] until 29 May
2010, when he finished his running.

### Television

In 2015, Holland appeared in four episodes of [BBC Two](/wiki/BBC_Two "BBC
Two")'s TV series _[Wolf Hall](/wiki/Wolf_Hall_\(miniseries\) "Wolf Hall
\(miniseries\)")_ , as [Gregory
Cromwell](/wiki/Gregory_Cromwell,_1st_Baron_Cromwell "Gregory Cromwell, 1st
Baron Cromwell"), son of the protagonist [Thomas
Cromwell](/wiki/Thomas_Cromwell "Thomas Cromwell") played by [Mark
Rylance](/wiki/Mark_Rylance "Mark Rylance").[20]

### Cinema

In 2011, Holland was cast in the British version of the animated film
_[Arrietty](/wiki/Arrietty "Arrietty")_ , produced by Japan’s [Studio
Ghibli](/wiki/Studio_Ghibli "Studio Ghibli"). He provided a voice for the
principal character Sho.[21]

Holland made his feature film debut in _[The
Impossible](/wiki/The_Impossible_\(2012_film\) "The Impossible \(2012
film\)")_ , directed by [Juan Antonio Bayona](/wiki/Juan_Antonio_Bayona "Juan
Antonio Bayona"), alongside [Naomi Watts](/wiki/Naomi_Watts "Naomi Watts") and
[Ewan McGregor](/wiki/Ewan_McGregor "Ewan McGregor"). Holland was praised so
highly, that there were even rumors he was a contender for a [Academy
Award](/wiki/Academy_Award "Academy Award") nomination.The film premiered at
the [Toronto International Film
Festival](/wiki/Toronto_International_Film_Festival "Toronto International
Film Festival") on 9 September 2012 and was a critical and commercial success,
earning $180.3 million worldwide and Holland won universal praise from critics
and several awards such as the [National Board of Review Award for
Breakthrough
Performance](/wiki/National_Board_of_Review_Award_for_Breakthrough_Performance
"National Board of Review Award for Breakthrough Performance") and [London
Film Critics Circle Award for Young British Performer of the
Year](/wiki/London_Film_Critics_Circle_Awards_2012 "London Film Critics Circle
Awards 2012").[22][23]

Holland starred as Isaac in the drama film _[How I Live
Now](/wiki/How_I_Live_Now_\(film\) "How I Live Now \(film\)")_ , which was
released in the U.K. on 4 October 2013, co-starring [Saoirse
Ronan](/wiki/Saoirse_Ronan "Saoirse Ronan") and co-starred as [Thomas
Nickerson](/wiki/Thomas_Nickerson "Thomas Nickerson") in the film _[In the
Heart of the Sea](/wiki/In_the_Heart_of_the_Sea_\(film\) "In the Heart of the
Sea \(film\)")_ (2015), directed by [Ron Howard](/wiki/Ron_Howard "Ron
Howard").[24]

In 2016, he plays Bradley Baker in the film _[Edge of
Winter](/wiki/Edge_of_Winter_\(film\) "Edge of Winter \(film\)")_ , where he
co-stars with [Joel Kinnaman](/wiki/Joel_Kinnaman "Joel Kinnaman") and [Percy
Hynes White](/w/index.php?title=Percy_Hynes_White&action=edit&redlink=1 "Percy
Hynes White \(page does not exist\)"). In 2017, Holland co-starred alongside
[Charlie Hunnam](/wiki/Charlie_Hunnam "Charlie Hunnam") in the drama film
_[The Lost City of Z](/wiki/The_Lost_City_of_Z_\(film\) "The Lost City of Z
\(film\)")_ , directed by [James Gray](/wiki/James_Gray_\(film_director\)
"James Gray \(film director\)"), and released in April, to positive critical
reception.[25]

In 2017, he co-stars alongside [Richard
Armitage](/wiki/Richard_Armitage_\(actor\) "Richard Armitage \(actor\)") and
[Jon Bernthal](/wiki/Jon_Bernthal "Jon Bernthal") in the film
_[Pilgrimage](/wiki/Pilgrimage_\(2017_film\) "Pilgrimage \(2017 film\)")_. The
film was released on 23 April 2017 in the [Tribeca Film
Festival](/wiki/Tribeca_Film_Festival "Tribeca Film Festival") in its
"Viewpoint" sections.

#### Spider-Man

On 23 June 2015, it was announced that Holland was cast as a teenage [Peter
Parker / Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man "Spider-Man"),[26] and his "life was
flipped upside down", as he later tweeted.[27] As part of the [Marvel
Cinematic Universe](/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe "Marvel Cinematic
Universe"), he first appeared as Spider-Man in _[Captain America: Civil
War](/wiki/Captain_America:_Civil_War "Captain America: Civil War")_
(2016).[28] The film was a massive critical and commercial success, grossing
over $1.1 billion worldwide, making it the highest-grossing film of 2016,[29]
with Holland receiving critical praise.[30][31]

In July 2017, _[Spider-Man: Homecoming](/wiki/Spider-Man:_Homecoming "Spider-
Man: Homecoming")_ was released, in which Holland reprised his role from
_Captain America: Civil War_. Earning $117,027,503 in box office receipts in
its first weekend,[32] _Homecoming_ received positive reviews and Holland
considerable praise, with his appearance being called "a star performance
given by a born actor."[33] Holland is scheduled to reprise his role of
Spider-Man in _[Avengers: Infinity War](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War
"Avengers: Infinity War")_ and its [untitled
sequel](/wiki/Untitled_Avengers_film "Untitled Avengers film"), each scheduled
to be released on 4 May 2018, and 3 May 2019, respectively, as well as the
sequel to _Homecoming_ , which has a release date of 5 July 2019.[34][35][36]
He has a six-picture deal with [Marvel Studios](/wiki/Marvel_Studios "Marvel
Studios") not including his _[Captain America: Civil
War](/wiki/Captain_America:_Civil_War "Captain America: Civil War")_
appearance.[37]

Holland was originally cast in the _Jumanji_ remake but had to give up the
role to focus on _Spider-Man_. [Nick Jonas](/wiki/Nick_Jonas "Nick Jonas")
replaced him in that film.[38]

### Upcoming works

Holland was cast to play [Samuel Insull](/wiki/Samuel_Insull "Samuel Insull")
in [Alfonso Gomez-Rejon](/wiki/Alfonso_Gomez-Rejon "Alfonso Gomez-Rejon")'s
_[The Current War](/wiki/The_Current_War "The Current War")_ , which will be
released on 24 November 2017.[39] Holland was cast in the [film
adaptation](/wiki/Chaos_Walking_\(film\) "Chaos Walking \(film\)") of [Patrick
Ness](/wiki/Patrick_Ness "Patrick Ness")'s bestselling YA series _[Chaos
Walking](/wiki/Chaos_Walking "Chaos Walking")_ as Todd Hewitt, alongside with
Star Wars star [Daisy Ridley](/wiki/Daisy_Ridley "Daisy Ridley"), which will
be directed by [Doug Liman](/wiki/Doug_Liman "Doug Liman").[40] In May 2017,
it was announced that he had been cast as a young [Nathan
Drake](/wiki/Nathan_Drake_\(character\) "Nathan Drake \(character\)") in the
[film adaptation](/wiki/Uncharted#Film_adaptation "Uncharted") of [Naughty
Dog](/wiki/Naughty_Dog "Naughty Dog")'s [_Uncharted_ video game
series](/wiki/Uncharted "Uncharted").[41] He is also now cast as the lead role
in the film adaptation of _Beneath the Scarlet Sky_ with Pascal Pictures.[42]
He is set to star in [20th Century Fox
Animation](/wiki/20th_Century_Fox_Animation "20th Century Fox Animation")'s
_[Spies in Disguise](/wiki/Spies_in_Disguise "Spies in Disguise")_ in 2019
alongside [Will Smith](/wiki/Will_Smith "Will Smith").[43]

Holland says that his long-term career plans are to "do some more franchises,"
play "some meatier indie roles and eventually . . . transition to the other
side of the camera and branch into directing." [44]

## Personal life

Holland resides in the [London](/wiki/London "London") neighbourhood of
Kingston upon Thames, near the house of his parents and younger brothers.[45]
He has a dog named Tessa.[46] When he was seven years old, Holland was
diagnosed with [dyslexia](/wiki/Dyslexia "Dyslexia").[47] Holland is a
supporter of English football club [Arsenal](/wiki/Arsenal_F.C. "Arsenal
F.C.") and also practises [gymnastics](/wiki/Gymnastics "Gymnastics").[48]

Along with his three siblings Holland sponsors The Brothers Trust, a UK
[Registered Charity](/wiki/Charitable_Organization "Charitable Organization")
that raises money for various charitable causes.[49]

Holland publicly credits his father, comedian and writer [Dominic
Holland](/wiki/Dominic_Holland "Dominic Holland"), for keeping his massive
wave of _Spider-Man_ fame from going to his head.[44]
